title: Twitch Buffs
body:
Pls...

somewhere. He needs a thing because he's just so aggravating to play at every phase of the game.

replies.body:
...Care to give us your suggestions?

Not that you're wrong, it's just that everyone can tell a car is broken when it doesn't start, but not everyone knows how to get it working again. Simply stating that something's wrong doesn't help fix it though.

Stealthing with Q instantly but leaving a trail for maybe 2 secs after?
Make his R a heavily mana draining toggle (Think Swain or Anivia)?
Remove cap from how many passive stacks he can have (his E is a worse version of Kalista's E)?
Really?  Yeah, that's not toxic as shit.

No need to be so rude, I was just throwing some ideas around, infact I really like the stealthing instantly with Q but leaving a trail, it allows enemies to know where he is and throw some CC his way or place a ward but it also allows Twitch a little bit of disengage, even if it isn't very effective.

Yeah, and then who can engage on him then?  You know why Twitch's stealth was nerfed in the first place?  Because you'd whittle him down to 10 health, and then he'd just poof away and you couldn't do anything because you couldn't see him.

At least with Akali you know that she's somewhere in the general area.

At least with Teemo you know he's completely still when he's stealthed.

At least with Eve you can see her once you get close enough.

The problem with Twitch's Q being a toggle is that the range on his ultimate is stupid.  For a minute long cooldown, it's balanced, for a toggle, it's seriously overpowered (my same gripe with Swain).

But you WOULD know where twitch is because for the first few seconds after he enters invisibility he would leave a trail that basically says "AIM YOUR SKILLSHOTS HERE" and the ultimate being a toggle could be balanced by huge mana costs.

Skillshots?

{{champion:21}} {{champion:18}} 

The issue here is that he's not just going to be derping around the lane if he uses that to escape. He's going to run under tower.  This was the problem with Twitch that the nerfs addressed.  Now if he takes damage, he's not going to be able to stealth as quickly, giving you a window to kill him.

Doing this would remove that window of counterplay.  Sure you'll be able to bully Twitch out of lane, but you'll never be able to kill him until late game, which is a major issue considering he's a hypercarry.  He has a normal hypercarry power curve.  What you're doing is buffing his early game to Tristana levels with no tradeoff.  He'd just be ridiculously good at all stages of the game.

> the ultimate being a toggle could be balanced by huge mana costs.

You know why Ahri's ultimate is duration based?  Because if it was a charge system that cost mana each time, she'd turn into Kassadin always having her dash up.

If Twitch gets that treatment, he'd always have his ridiculous poke up.  He'd just push lanes to death.

MF does have ground-targeted damage in make it rain and her ultimate.

And if trist can't kill him then it just happens that he counters her (Even though she could still use her leap or place a timebomb on him before he stealths)

I don't really believe the ult change is a good idea (Although the Q is) but the fact is a toggled buff is different from a Kog'Maw effect on a dash.

> MF does have ground-targeted damage in make it rain and her ultimate.

So I have to ult Twitch in order to secure a kill on a basic ability?  Do you know how freaking long MF's ult's cooldown is?  It's literally up there with pre 5.9 Garen's.  Twitch already counters her, and she's already getting hit hard late game with GW removal, and now you're proposing that counter be even harder.


> And if trist can't kill him then it just happens that he counters her (Even though she could still use her leap or place a timebomb on him before he stealths)

Also, Tristana counters Twitch.  She actually counters him at all stages of the game.  There's no reason to make it the other way around.


> I don't really believe the ult change is a good idea (Although the Q is)

No, it really isn't.  It'd literally be the second most toxic invisibility spell behind Shaco's, and Shaco's Q is literally one of the most toxic things in the game.
Or use make it rain. And Trist cold STILL kill him with her jump, or she could drop pink, or she could follow the trail and make an educated guess on where twitch will go as it's pretty easy to see.

First point irrelevant You don't save ults. Moron, you pop everything to secure if you have to. only if its necessary, but you use all the cd's and all the mana if it is. 
 
Things like this happen every rework, meta and counters sift literally every time. so if twitch happens to be good against trist after, it's still fair.

You think stealth is toxic? get a pink ward or upgraded red trinket, then stealth means literally nothing to you. you want to see some real toxic abilities, look at nasus q, or tryndamere ult, or kayle ult, or poppy ult. all of these abilities are far more toxic because you actually can't do shit for any of them. the only one that has any sort of counterplay is nasus q, but you can't deny him farm the whole goddam game.
His q and ulti are the only things in his kit that don't need to be changed.  His passive, w, and e and just completely useless.

I'd start with chaning his ult name back to Spray and Pray and turning his e name to fester (cause expunge didn't fit anymore).

For actually helpful suggestions, how about limitless poison stack or harder scaling for poinson stacks regarding e's damage? How about more bonus ad on ult or a higher ad ratio on e? How about a q that isn't ass because minions number 12 decided to auto me once during my animation?

How about passive damage that isn't canceled by fucking nasus' warmog/sv combo. :/

I once asked for his passive to instead be based off his current AD. At a ratio of 0.02 or 2%. So, if he has 100 AD, he deals 2 damage each second (stays at up to 6 stacks, stays at up to 6 seconds of damage). The damage can increase to beyond just 6 damage per second, and early game is automatically 1 dps anyway. So, if you get a lot of AD, like 400 or more, the passive now allows 8 damage per second. Someone else asked why it couldn't be 0.04 or 4% of AD, and I said I like to keep it at a low ratio. It'd also allow for a higher early passive. At least 2 damage per second, but it will allow Twitch to keep AA easier. Only needs 200 AD to do 8 damage per second. (Up to 48 damage over 6 seconds.)
If you have a friend({{champion:32}} ), try Cass Twitch bot... You'll like it. A lot

Toxic team OP.

{{champion:27}} Top

{{champion:17}} Mid

{{champion:69}} "Support"

{{champion:29}} ADC

{{champion:41}} Jungle

Of course post rework you'd have to find another poison based champion to jungle.

Malz perhaps?

I would prefer a buff to {{champion:29}}'s w, so to make it stronger while making it more interesting as an ability. 

Just some suggestions:

* The center of the aoe will apply a heavier slow and 3 stacks instead of 2
* Decrease the amount of time it takes for the bottle to hit at max range
* Increasing the range of the ability
* Twitch gains movespeed, the more champions the bottle hits the better his speed

I feel like Twitch is a weaker version of Vayne with the exception he has probably the best teamfighting of all ADCs. He can deal damage to their entire team over the course of about 8 seconds if I remember correctly, hitting the enemy's backline without even being close to their frontline. His teamfighting is better than Sivir's, Jinx's, and Miss Fortune's easily however aside from that there's not a whole lot of reason to pick him over Vayne. They both have incredible late game damage with huge amounts of true damage with a pretty weak early game.

Twitch isnt bad at every phase of the game. This is where over-dramatization makes you look like an idiot.

I played a match with Twitch ADC. Our jungler constantly ganked, only to feed the enemy ADC. They were at our second turret, about to nab their 4th Dragon. I picked up {{item:3143}} for the Armor to combat the enemy ADC. Enemy ADC also decided to go glass cannon build. Due to my extra armor and life steal, i was able to pick off the ADC, along with 3 more enemies for a turnaround Quadra. Then we got Dragon, pushed the lane, and ultimately won the game.

Twitch doesnt suck every phase of the game.

So you call someone an idiot cause of 1 lucky game?


I really hope you aen't  adult, cause there still might be hope for you when you grow up.

I'm not calling him an idiot because my one lucky game. It's because he's saying Twitch is bad through the entire game.

Twitch kind of is bad on all stages.

Maybe his damage sky rockets trough ceiling, but he has no way to defend for himself nor run away abilities.

Which means that any assassin can shut him down before he fires second AA powered by ultimate.

randuins on an adc who needs his core items as fast as possible to not be useless? interesting interesting.... i mean his lategame is awesome because his ultimate can destroy whole teams but his early is just awful. and why should i play twitch when i just can play jinx who also destroys whole teams with her rocket launcher AoE crits and can chase enemies down with her passive (that's one bad point about twitch, people get out of his range pretty easily expect you're fighting in the jungle or something) while her laning phase is also decent? that's why nobody plays twitch as well as many other champs, unfortunately there are just better options

Expunge is useless and his passive is weak.   

Change his passive to 8/12/16 flat true damage (extra stacks dont increase damage), can stack up to 4/5 times.

At 4/5 stacks you can activate expunge to do 4/6/8/10/12% max health damage and reduce vision for 3 seconds.

Make his flask scale of AD, apply 2 stacks, and apply a slow.


This fix's his kit and makes him relevent.    Q and ult need no change.
Its a shame that Twitch lost his stacking ADC identity thanks to {{champion:429}}.
The only thing Twitch needs is his passive to scale better into the late game, and a rework on his E.

Reverting the number nerfs to E and passive would be a good start since they are no longer needed.

Passive could also be changed to magic damage but increasing the damage by ~80% so it is better against enemies with less than 80 MR (is there a reason for it to deal true damage anyways?). 

I'd like his R to grant 40/60/80% AS instead of AD (more synergy with BotRK and IE). Remove the damage reduction on successive enemies hit (more rewards for good ults). Maybe reduce CD a bit too.

yes, he needs buffs somewhere. his passive is an inferior {{champion:122}} bleed that only scales with level and is barely noticeable. his q takes 6 seconds to activate if you are taking damage, i understand the concept of the ability being focused on catching out and not escaping but 6 seconds is insane, sometimes you can forget that your q is activating. his w is basically a weak aoe slow, helps a bit with waveclear but deals no damage by itself (personally i only put one point in it and max it last). his e is a weaker {{champion:429}}, it has a cap, it doesnt slow, it doesnt reset or refund mana. his ult is good at least.

Slight movement speed buff. 325 -> 330. Would help him roam, get in position during teamfights, and escape ganks easier.

Deadly Venom -> Now does double damage to monsters. Gives him a helpful niche in Baron/Dragon control, and makes jungle Twitch viable again.

Ambush -> Delay on damage reduced to 4 from 6.

Contaminate -> Killing a unit restores a small portion of the mana cost.

Twitch doesn't need more damage. He has that in spades. What he needs is more tools that help him reach his two item spike.

And I wanna jungle Twitch again.
